text: Wamba is a small town in Kenya. It is in the Samburu district. The Wamba administrative division is there. The town has a big Catholic hospital. The hospital is considered important to the Samburu district.Paolo Tablino, Christianity Among the Nomads, Volume 1: The Catholic Church in Northern Kenya (Nairobi: Consolata Fathers, 2006), p. 280 The town plays a role in the tourism industry in Kenya. It has strong ties with Prince William of Britain due to his efforts to promote conservation and ties with Samburu communities.http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/africa/2013-11/22/c_132908014.htm == References == Category:Towns in Kenya
title: Wamba
